Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Portfolio
public class Portfolio extends Object
The main class that computes majority of the portfolo functions and has various helper methods that are used throughout the main class. The class acts as an eportfolio for a users investments.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

    • compSymbol

      public static int compSymbol(String symbol, ArrayList<Investment> investments)
      Compares user input symbol with the symbols in the array list of type investment to find a matching object.
      Parameters:
      symbol - of the stock
      investments - which is the array list for investment
      Returns:
      the index of the object that matches the symbol

    • validQuant

      public static int validQuant(String symbol, int index, String quantity, ArrayList<Investment> investments)
      Ensures and checks that the quantity the user wants to sell of the investment is within the range of quantity availible in their portfolio. Making the program robust.
      Parameters:
      investType - String type of the type of investment
      symbol - of the investment
      index - of the object in the array list
      investments - array list for all investments (mutual fund and stock)
      Returns:
      a valid int user input of the number of quantity they want to sell of the investment

    • searchRange

      public static boolean searchRange(String range, int index, ArrayList<Investment> investments)
      Searches and matches the user input range with the object prices
      Parameters:
      range - user input of the range of price they want to search
      index - of the object in the array list
      investments - array list for all investments (mutual fund and stock)
      Returns:
      a boolean value indicating if the object is within the user input range or not

    • updateHashMap

      public static void updateHashMap(HashMap<String,ArrayList<Integer>> keyWords, ArrayList<Investment> investments)
      Populates the hashmap with the key and their corresponding list indexes
      Parameters:
      keyWords - is the hashmap of all the keywords available and the corresponding indexes
      investments - array list for all investments (mutual fund and stock)

    • reduceHashMap

      public static void reduceHashMap(int index, HashMap<String,ArrayList<Integer>> keyWords)
      Changes indexes of each object within each key that is affected by the removal of an object from the list
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the object that is removed from the array list
      keyWords - is the hashmap of all keywords available and the corresponding indexes

    • buy

      public static String buy(String investInpt, String symbInp, String nameInp, String quantInp, String priceInp)
      Method is invoked when the user slects buy investment from the front end GUI. This will either create a new investment with the according type and either update or create the investment with the user inputted values.
      Parameters:
      investInpt - user investment type input
      symbInp - user symbol input
      nameInp - user name input
      quantInp - user quantity input
      priceInp - user price input
      Returns:
      string that contains the output for the investment with the proper toString() formatting of the investment and the attribues.

    • sell

      public static String sell(String symbInp, String quantInp, String priceInp)
      Method is used for selling and is nvoked when user selects sell in front end GUI. Investments are sold and prices are updated and changed according to user input. This will also update the hashmap according to how the arraylist is changed.
      Parameters:
      symbInp - user symbol input.
      quantInp - user quantity input.
      priceInp - user price input.
      Returns:
      Message is a string that gets returned with the approriate output of the stock updated, which is the gain and payment.

    • update

      public String update(String priceStr, int index)
      method updates the investment price that user wants to update.
      Parameters:
      priceStr - user input for price.
      index - index for the investment the user wants to update.
      Returns:
      returns the invesment output that is updated as a string for front end GUI.

    • gain

      public static String gain()
      Method calculates gain for the front end gain GUI. This calculates total gain and gain for each investment.
      Returns:
      a string of the gain for each investment.

    • search

      public static String search(String symbInp, String nameKeyInp, String lowInp, String highInp)
      The method is used for searching investments using attributes provided from user in the search GUI.
      Parameters:
      symbInp - user symbol input.
      nameKeyInp - user key words input.
      lowInp - user string value for minimum price input.
      highInp - user string value for minimum price input.
      Returns:
      A string of all investments that suit that attributes user inputted. Used to display in front end GUI.

    • priceInput

      public static double priceInput(String priceStr)
      Ensures that price is a valid input and parses correctly. Method handles cases such as neg or zero values and parsing.
      Parameters:
      priceStr - User input for price from GUI.
      Returns:
      the parsed value for price.

    • quantInput

      public static int quantInput(String quantStr)
      Ensures that the quantity input from user is a valid input and parses correctly. Method handles the case where quantity is neg or zero. Or if the value input is not a number.
      Parameters:
      quantStr - User input for quantity from front end GUI.
      Returns:
      the parsed quantity input from user.

    • symbolInput

      public static String symbolInput(String symbolTxt)
      Ensures that user input is the correct parameters for symbol.
      Parameters:
      symbolTxt - user input for symbol from front end GUI.
      Returns:
      string value of user input for symbol.

    • rangeValid

      public static void rangeValid(String min, String max)
      Method identifies if user inputs a range with both max and min and ensures that the range is appropriate.
      Parameters:
      min - is the string min value inputted from user in front end
      max - is the string max value inputted from user in front end
